intro: Aegopodium tenerum, commonly known as slender ground-ivy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its small, white or greenish flowers are typically arranged in umbels, and it has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Aegopodium tenerum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
